channel.title: CVE Feed for IBM -- Jazz for Service Management
channel.description: The latest CVEs for IBM -- Jazz for Service Management

item.title: CVE-2021-29831|2024-09-16T16:43:23.436Z -- ibm -- jazz%20for%20service%20management
item.description: IBM Jazz for Service Management 1.1.3.10 and IBM Tivoli Netcool/OMNIbus_GUI is vulnerable to an XML External Entity Injection (XXE) attack when processing XML data. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to expose sensitive information or consume memory resources. IBM X-Force ID: 204775.

item.title: CVE-2019-4201|2024-09-16T17:53:13.080Z -- ibm -- jazz%20for%20service%20management
item.description: IBM Jazz for Service Management 1.1.3, 1.1.3.1, and 1.1.3.2 could allow a remote attacker to conduct phishing attacks, using an open redirect attack. By persuading a victim to visit a specially-crafted Web site, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to spoof the URL displayed to redirect a user to a malicious Web site that would appear to be trusted. This could allow the attacker to obtain highly sensitive information or conduct further attacks against the victim. IBM X-Force ID: 159122.

item.title: CVE-2019-4193|2024-09-16T17:58:44.822Z -- ibm -- jazz%20for%20service%20management
item.description: IBM Jazz for Service Management 1.1.3 and 1.1.3.2 stores sensitive information in URL parameters. This may lead to information disclosure if unauthorized parties have access to the URLs via server logs, referrer header or browser history. IBM X-force ID: 159032.

item.title: CVE-2019-4186|2024-09-16T16:43:20.348Z -- ibm -- jazz%20for%20service%20management
item.description: IBM Jazz for Service Management 1.1.3 is vulnerable to HTTP header injection, caused by incorrect trust in the HTTP Host header during caching. By sending a specially crafted HTTP GET request, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to inject arbitrary HTTP headers, which will allow the attacker to conduct various attacks against the vulnerable system, including cross-site scripting, cache poisoning or session hijacking. IBM X-force ID: 158976.
